response:
MRI is required to visualise the suspected inflammatory lesions in the optic nerve and spinal cord and to check for other silent lesions (dissemination in space). Serology for specific antibodies (AQP4, MOG) and CSF analysis are essential to differentiate between MS and NMOSD/MOGAD.

investigations = ["MRI of brain and whole spine with gadolinium", "Aquaporin-4 antibodies", "Anti-MOG antibodies", "Lumbar puncture for CSF analysis and oligoclonal bands", "Visual Evoked Potentials", "Full blood count", "Urea and electrolytes", "Liver function tests", "C-reactive protein", "Erythrocyte sedimentation rate", "Serum B12 and folate", "Autoimmune screen (ANA, ENA, dsDNA)", "Syphilis serology", "HIV serology"]
